title: Exchange NFT for physical product.
description:
Pre-selling physical products as NFTs unlocks many new business models.

There is currently no public tooling to achieve this.

f6_assessments.q0:
Although the project may partly adresses the challenge, it clearly lacks precision and details to assess it correctly.

I would suggest to try again in the next fund, with a more detailled problem statement and more a elaborate solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is a total lack of information about the proposer, except what is stated in the proposal, no linkdin link nor any other external sources. No clear plan, no metrics. 

This proposal needs to be refined.
f6_assessments.q2:
It is not clear either you are planning partnerships with manufacturing plants, or, if you already have means of production, and what kind of goods we are talking about.
Also, about the open source functionnality and docs, who would it be intended for? i don't understand.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very short and it is hard to judge whether the proposal meets the challenge criteria provided. I would like the team to further expand on the value the proposal will bring to the ecosystem. I would also like the team to rewrite the problem statement and solution to the business model proposed.
f6_assessments.q1: Using NFTs to presale physical goods is a good idea. However the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. The team can expand on the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal, what are the responsibilities and deliverables of each member. I would like to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed". I would like the team to expand on the go to market strategy to recruit sellers to the platform.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has no roadmap and single line budget. I would like to see the team develop Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project based on a monthly timetable and connect the KPIs to milestones on the project roadmap (timeline). I would like to see the team create a solid roadmap -  develop and add milestones to provide deeper detail, set technical development milestones for creating the product. I would like to see the budget developed beyond a single line entry and broken down into monthly spending, and I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the spending, what are the specific tasks and deliverables that the developers must provide and when must they deliver the tasks – this breakdown will give a clearer indication about the implementation workload feasibility and match the deliverables to the spending - thus the team can track performance and spending over a timeline. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem description and solution are related to the challenge, but there is no plan, the proposal is just a draft, and there is not enough information to assess impact. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document Proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is possible to use tags in IdeaScale to signal the need for a developer or search for developers in Catalyst channels on Discord and Telegram.

There is no plan, the proposal is just a draft, there is not enough information to assess feasibility. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document Proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no plan, the proposal is just a draft, and there is not enough information to assess auditability. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document Proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem stated in this proposal is pretty broad. It is difficult for me to understand the problem and its relation with the challenge. I suggest to the proposer to review the probleme statement to make ti more precise. I also think that the proposer should explain clearly how the this proposal will add value to the cardon ecosystem. The proposal lack key metrics and a clear goal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer did not provide enough informations about team. There are no ressources or links on the team. The informations about the ressources needed for the execution of this project are missing. The proposer did not include a timetable or a budget breakdown. I can't say if the budget is reasonable. This proposal doesn't include enough informations. I dont't think that this proposal can be implemented successfully at its current state.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is missing KPIs and a roadmap with milestone. Since these informations are critical in order to audit the project proprely, I dont think this project will be auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very synthesized, so we cannot understand the details of the project. In theory, we know that the author's intention fits with the main objective of the challenge, which is to promote the adoption of NFT, through the creation of NFT for physical producers. In practice, we have no idea of ​​what this would be like, for this reason, unfortunately, there is no way to measure the impact.
f6_assessments.q1: The author gives us only two brief pieces of information about himself. The first is that he is developing a fashion product and the second that he is in the marketing area. Right, but we would need to know things like: what fashion product is this, what kind of marketing activity it does, because marketing is very broad, how much experience it has, examples of places it has worked, and so on. And also what would be the hiring of the developer Plutus that he mentions, that is, how long would he work, under what regime, etc? As for the roadmap, we don't have, we don't know what phases we would compose the project, not even when it intends to be launched or how the funding money would be used.
f6_assessments.q2: The author does not develop the impact that his proposal would cause on the cardano ecosystem, does not establish success metrics so that the community could monitor the project development, nor where this monitoring would take place. There is literally nothing to do with auditability, unfortunately. It would be necessary to trace the things I mentioned above so that we could see the progress of the idea, if what was promised would be fulfilled and so on.

f6_assessments.q0: Although the Challenge is well described and is an important component open with smart contract the proposal partially addresses the challenge. More details how to get there needs to be detailed. Its a great start.
f6_assessments.q1: From marketing aspect there is good experience but from development side and what needs to be done to achieve the solution is lacking. Requires perhaps partnering with a Plutus pioneer or developer.
f6_assessments.q2: There needs to be more clarification as to the stages to measure the progress, how the funds used? and what are the key indicators necessary to achieve the solution.

solution:
Create open source functionality and docs.

 NFTs give access to a smart contract. This automates an order to manufacture and/or deliver.
experience:
Building an NFT fashion brand on Cardano.

8 Years in marketing - Currently writing for IO.

Looking to hire Plutus Pioneer to develop.
